ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 12 hours on average for project work, but comes in bursts. 4-5 hours on readings when assigned.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed this course! I thought the readings were complex and forced you to think critically about your role and project. I had a great group and an awesome project and feel very proud of what we accomplished this semester. The faculty members have differing skills and knowledge and they complement each other nicely. It would be great if there could be a group bonding event towards the beginning of the semester to help groups mesh.

This course was incredible. I wish we had more opportunities to apply the reading material to our specific projects in diverse ways. The in class discussions were very helpful but I felt limited by the format and the time.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Alice M Miller  Ali was very pleasant to work with! Her passion, eloquence, and knowledge are both intimidating and inspiring. Her comments / feedback are not always completely clear, but she is quite adept at explaining what she means if you ask.

Instructor: Alice M Miller  Ali has made a huge difference in the way I approach my work. Her guidance and continual search for more opportunities for collaboration and application has renewed my excitement for what I hope to contribute throughout my academic and professional career. Additionally her instruction has made me more confident.
Instructor: Amy Nicole Kapczynski  Amy's knowledge base and personality help to balance out Ali and Gregg in the discussion portion of the class.
Instructor: Amy Nicole Kapczynski  Amy challenges her students to always perform at their maximum. I feel very lucky to have been able to receive feedback and guidance from her this semester.

Instructor: Gregg Steven Gonsalves  Gregg's firebrand ways and activist approach provides a fresh perspective in an academic setting and helps create an unique dynamic in the classroom! Email assignments were not always completely clear.
Instructor: Gregg Steven Gonsalves  Gregg is inspiring and semi-magical in his ability to reframe questions and theories. I am very grateful to have had him as and instructor and to look up to him.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Clinic-based course that involves semester long group work that is often open ended and student directed. Requires substantial time commitment but being worth 2 credits helps make it reasonable! If you are interested in the interactions of law and health, either domestically or internationally, this is the course for you!

This course will be challenging. I was formative in my academic development. I recommend this to any student who wants to make lasting partnerships and work hard and passionately on a specific project.
